intro: Camelina parodii, commonly known as the parodii mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from late spring to early summer. Camelina parodii is characterized by its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
